channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Coffee on floor outside 25 bake street need was, 2nd October
item.description:
Washing required at pavement of 25 baker street near jn to george street due to spill of coffee.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20a, Baker Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags on horse and fish roundabouts blocking visibility, 2nd October
item.description:
Both these roundabouts are covered in flags, and they are causing an immediate danger to the public as they reduce visibility for drivers. The flags also cause a distraction which further increases the chances that an accident will happen sooner rather than later. These flags really need to be removed as soon as possible. Social media posts suggest that the trogolodytes responsible are planning to replace any flags removed so I woudl alo urge the Council to find some way of tackling this issue (bear traps perhaps)?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queens Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously overhanging tree and dropping of crab apples, 2nd October
item.description:
I have reported this many times and if you look over previous reports there was an action for you to cut back the tree and for me to trim back my hedge which I did. Yesterday getting out of my car I slipped on the crab apples and have now put my back out . I am continuing sweeping up theses crab apples to keep all pedestrians safe and considering I pay £250 pm for council tax I don’t actually think it’s my job to!! This tree must be replaced with another tree if I do not receive a satisfactory response I will be taking this matter further .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, The Crescent, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped vehicle, 2nd October
item.description:
Vehicle registration CK03 ODV blue ford has been parked up in Tyrell avenue for over a year never moved has been there so long weeds have grown round it the tyres are flat it needs removing because sometimes it’s difficult for other vehicles to get through especially emergency services I have checked and it’s not taxed or MOT’d
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tyrrell Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Norman road., 2nd October
item.description:
Lots of litter always left in the flowerbeds and on the street outside of valegro house opposite the north pole. I cleared it up myself two weeks ago and it’s already back. Perhaps at the least a bin could be installed here as it’s clearly a litter hotspot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 114, Norman Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
